channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kamala Harris Keeps Reminding Voters She’s ‘Joe Biden 2.0’
item.description: CNN hosted a town hall with Kamala Harris Wednesday night, and it went about as poorly as you’d expect. When she wasn’t avoiding questions prospective...

item.title: Happy 60th Anniversary CAPM! Why the Capital Asset Pricing Model Still Matters
item.description: The CAPM has its critics. Yet, the model, introduced by Bill Sharpe in 1964, remains front and center in academia and in practice.

item.title: Unilever sales growth accelerates under CEO’s overhaul plan
item.description: Revenue increased 4.5% in the third quarter, beating the 4.3% expected by analysts, the maker of soap and stock cubes said Thursday.

item.description: Trump doubled his share of the black vote from 6 percent to 12 percent in the last election, and some polls suggest the Republican president could do ...

item.title: ‘Donald Trump Is Old,’ Sputters a Tired and Wheezing Harris Campaign
item.description: The attempt to highlight Trump’s age is rich given rather recent Democratic history.

item.title: Goldman Sachs-backed Simbe raises $50M in Series C funding to bolster retail robot business
item.description: Simbe is now working with 29 retail brands.

item.title: Foreign Censorship Outfit That Advises Kamala Harris Aims To ‘Kill Musk’s Twitter’
item.description: Musk responded Tuesday with a three word post: 'This is war.'

item.title: Republicans Are Gaining on Democrats in Early and Mail-In Voting
item.description: Trump has long disparaged early and mail-in voting. But his campaign seems to be benefiting from an opposite shift in GOP voting behavior.

item.title: Early in-person voting kicks off in Maryland
item.description: Maryland joined a growing number of states to begin early in-person voting on Thursday.

item.title: Colin Allred Is No Voting-Rights Hero, Just a Partisan Democrat
item.description: The Democrats’ Senate candidate against Ted Cruz has never really done much besides be a partisan.

item.title: The Alternative Investment Gender Gap: Marketing to Female Clients
item.description: What are women's favorite alternative investments? What marketing strategies resonate with women, and which one's don't?

item.title: Ex-Obama aide explains why Kamala Harris is losing Gen Z men to Donald Trump
item.description: Harris isn’t meeting young male voters where they are—or where they get their news: “This is what Trump is doing every day.”

item.title: Harris won't say if she's more 'pro-Israel' than Trump
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris on Wednesday declined to answer if she is more "pro-Israel" than former President Donald Trump.

item.title: Harris struggles to name top policy goal if elected president
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris struggled Wednesday when asked to name her most important policy goal if elected president.

item.title: Daniel Penny’s Homicide Trial Begins
item.description: Manhattan DA Alvin Bragg is plowing forward with a case that never should have been charged.

item.title: Donald Trump’s flip-flopping on early voting isn’t the only reason Republicans are flocking to the polls, election expert says
item.description: More working-class voters, who have historically preferred early voting, are turning red.

item.title: Book Review: Resistance Money: A Philosophical Case for Bitcoin
item.description: Should I add bitcoin to my portfolio? If not, why not? This book will help advisors field these tough client questions.

item.title: Kamala Harris’s Biden Burden
item.description: The sitting president’s ‘lock him up’ gaffe is the latest example of how he’s a drag on his vice president’s campaign.

item.description: By learning to appreciate positive skew and its associated tail events, investors can unlock the full potential of stock market gains.
